item.title: All organisms vary

item.title: viruses are not considered to be living
item.description: viruses are not considered to be living

item.title: The 5 kingdoms - Monera, Bacteria, Fungi, Plants, Animals
item.description: The 5 kingdoms - Monera, Bacteria, Fungi, Plants, Animals

item.title: Phylum, Plants > Flowring, Non-Flowering. Animals > Vertibrate, invertebrate
item.description: Phylum, Plants > Flowring, Non-Flowering. Animals > Vertibrate, invertebrate

item.title: Class - Verterbate - birds, reptiles, amphibians, fish, mammals
item.description: Class - Verterbate - birds, reptiles, amphibians, fish, mammals

item.title: 3 Domains is another way of sorting animals
item.description: 3 Domains is another way of sorting animals

item.title: 3 Domains sorts by DNA
item.description: 3 Domains sorts by DNA

item.title: the 3 Domains are Eubacteria, Archea, Eukaryotes
item.description: the 3 Domains are Eubacteria, Archea, Eukaryotes

item.title: Eubacteria and Archea are bacteria which have no nucleus
item.description: Eubacteria and Archea are bacteria which have no nucleus

item.title: Eukaryotes is everything else (exc. Viruses)
item.description: Eukaryotes is everything else (exc. Viruses)

item.title: Naming Organisms - Genus then Species, Written in italics
item.description: Naming Organisms - Genus then Species, Written in italics

item.title: Carolus Linnaeus - Classified organisms regarding their reproductive system
item.description: Carolus Linnaeus - Classified organisms regarding their reproductive system

item.title: Taxonomic Ranks - Split kingdoms into more managable chunks
item.description: Taxonomic Ranks - Split kingdoms into more managable chunks

item.title: Taxonomic ranks - Kingodm, Pylum, Class, Order, Genus, Species
item.description: Taxonomic ranks - Kingodm, Pylum, Class, Order, Genus, Species

item.title: 2 types of adaptations - Morphological (physical), Behavioural (mental)
item.description: 2 types of adaptations - Morphological (physical), Behavioural (mental)

item.title: Limiting Population Size - Resources - Light, Food, Water, Oxygen, CO2, Minerals
item.description: Limiting Population Size - Resources - Light, Food, Water, Oxygen, CO2, Minerals

item.title: Plants compete for space, water, light, CO2, Nutrients
item.description: Plants compete for space, water, light, CO2, Nutrients

item.title: Animals Compete for Mates, Water, Terrotory, Food
item.description: Animals Compete for Mates, Water, Terrotory, Food

item.title: Interspecific Competition - Competition between different species
item.description: Interspecific Competition - Competition between different species

item.title: Intraspecific competition - Competition in same species
item.description: Intraspecific competition - Competition in same species

item.title: Biodiversity - number of different speicies in a particular area
item.description: Biodiversity - number of different speicies in a particular area

item.title: More Biodiversity - More Stable Environment
item.description: More Biodiversity - More Stable Environment

item.title: Maintaining boidiversity - Laws, More habitats, Conserve Habitats, Breeding programmes
item.description: Maintaining boidiversity - Laws, More habitats, Conserve Habitats, Breeding programmes

item.title: Distributions of organisms in an area - Transects(samples taken in a line)
item.description: Distributions of organisms in an area - Transects(samples taken in a line)

item.title: Biological Control - Introduction of natural predators to control a speicies
item.description: Biological Control - Introduction of natural predators to control a speicies

item.title: Alien Species are speicies not normally found in an area - Has Problems
item.description: Alien Species are speicies not normally found in an area - Has Problems

item.title: A.S Problems - Compete, have no predators, may have diseases
item.description: A.S Problems - Compete, have no predators, may have diseases

item.title: Each new cell needs a set of genes, contained in chromosones
item.description: Each new cell needs a set of genes, contained in chromosones

item.title: Chromosones are found in the nucleus of every cell
item.description: Chromosones are found in the nucleus of every cell

item.title: Humans have 46 chromosones, coming in 23 pairs
item.description: Humans have 46 chromosones, coming in 23 pairs

item.title: You recieve 23 chromosones from your mum and dad each
item.description: You recieve 23 chromosones from your mum and dad each

item.title: Each pair is similar, But not identical (allele)
item.description: Each pair is similar, But not identical (allele)

item.title: Sex - XY chromosones - Male / XX Chromosones - Female
item.description: Sex - XY chromosones - Male / XX Chromosones - Female

item.title: Cell division - mitosis - Two identical daughter cells
item.description: Cell division - mitosis - Two identical daughter cells

item.title: Mitosis - Chromosones replicate - Same number of chromosones
item.description: Mitosis - Chromosones replicate - Same number of chromosones

item.title: Mitosis - Growth, Replacement and repair
item.description: Mitosis - Growth, Replacement and repair

item.title: Cell Division - Meiosis
item.description: Cell Division - Meiosis

item.title: Meiosis - Gametes are formed, four daughter cells
item.description: Meiosis - Gametes are formed, four daughter cells

item.title: Meiosis - Haploid amount chromosones as mother, Daughter Cells not identical
item.description: Meiosis - Haploid amount chromosones as mother, Daughter Cells not identical

item.title: Meiosis - Reproduction (Sex Cells)
item.description: Meiosis - Reproduction (Sex Cells)

item.title: Cancer - Speed of Cell division relies on a gene, but fault means uncontrollable growth
item.description: Cancer - Speed of Cell division relies on a gene, but fault means uncontrollable growth

item.title: Cancer = Uncontrollable Mitosis
item.description: Cancer = Uncontrollable Mitosis

item.title: Stem Cells - Undifferentiated cell, use not specified.
item.description: Stem Cells - Undifferentiated cell, use not specified.

item.title: Stem cells can be found in the embryo
item.description: Stem cells can be found in the embryo

item.title: Stem Cells can treat Cancer, Blindness, Deafness, Spinal Cord Injury, Etc.
item.description: Stem Cells can treat Cancer, Blindness, Deafness, Spinal Cord Injury, Etc.

item.title: Stem Cells - Adapt, New cures can be found however seen as unethical, may be rejected
item.description: Stem Cells - Adapt, New cures can be found however seen as unethical, may be rejected

item.title: Protiens are the main constituents of the body's tissue
item.description: Protiens are the main constituents of the body's tissue

item.title: Various types of protein such as Enzymes, Hormones, Antibodies
item.description: Various types of protein such as Enzymes, Hormones, Antibodies

item.title: Proteins are made up of big long chains of amino acids, folded and coiled into a shape
item.description: Proteins are made up of big long chains of amino acids, folded and coiled into a shape

item.title: Production of proteins is cotrolled by DNA
item.description: Production of proteins is cotrolled by DNA

item.title: DNA can duplicate itself to produce copies
item.description: DNA can duplicate itself to produce copies

item.title: DNA has four bases (A/T, G/C), shaped in a double helix - sugar-phosphate backbone
item.description: DNA has four bases (A/T, G/C), shaped in a double helix - sugar-phosphate backbone

item.title: DNA coding - read in triplets and then a protein is made accordingly
item.description: DNA coding - read in triplets and then a protein is made accordingly

item.title: DNA Triplets known as a codon
item.description: DNA Triplets known as a codon

item.title: A gene is a short length of DNA which codes for a protein
item.description: A gene is a short length of DNA which codes for a protein

item.title: Genetic Profiling - Cells are cut up by enzymes and then travel along the machine to produce and electropherogram
item.description: Genetic Profiling - Cells are cut up by enzymes and then travel along the machine to produce and electropherogram

item.title: Genetic Profiling done by Gel Electrophoresis
item.description: Genetic Profiling done by Gel Electrophoresis

item.title: Genotype - Genetic make up of an induvidual
item.description: Genotype - Genetic make up of an induvidual

item.title: Phenotype - The pysical appearance of a genotype
item.description: Phenotype - The pysical appearance of a genotype

item.title: Homozygous - Identical alleles
item.description: Homozygous - Identical alleles

item.title: Heterozygous - Different alleles
item.description: Heterozygous - Different alleles

item.title: Selfing - Pollen from a plant is used to fertilise the same plant
item.description: Selfing - Pollen from a plant is used to fertilise the same plant

item.title: Genetic modification - Exctracting genes from one and into another
item.description: Genetic modification - Exctracting genes from one and into another

item.title: Genetic modification allows us to tailor organisms
item.description: Genetic modification allows us to tailor organisms

item.title: Continuous variation - Continuous range and caused by a range of genes (height, weight etc)
item.description: Continuous variation - Continuous range and caused by a range of genes (height, weight etc)

item.title: Discontinuous Variation - Caused by one gene, Distinct Groups
item.description: Discontinuous Variation - Caused by one gene, Distinct Groups

item.title: Mutation - Change in the structure of gene. Occur naturally, increased chance by radiation
item.description: Mutation - Change in the structure of gene. Occur naturally, increased chance by radiation

item.title: Mutations are harmful and beneficial
item.description: Mutations are harmful and beneficial

item.title: Gene Therapy can be used to remove the affects of a harmful allele
item.description: Gene Therapy can be used to remove the affects of a harmful allele

item.title: Gene Therapy can be done by intorducing a healthy allele or by switching off the harmful allele
item.description: Gene Therapy can be done by intorducing a healthy allele or by switching off the harmful allele

item.title: Gene Therapy - Expensive, Unethical / Cures illnesses, offers hope for a normal life
item.description: Gene Therapy - Expensive, Unethical / Cures illnesses, offers hope for a normal life

item.title: Exctinction can be caused by a species not adapting to it's new environment, or at all
item.description: Exctinction can be caused by a species not adapting to it's new environment, or at all

item.description: CNS = Central Nervous System

item.title: Neurone = Nerve Cell
item.description: Neurone = Nerve Cell

item.title: Muscles Sense Tension
item.description: Muscles Sense Tension

item.title: Cornea = Transparent area of outer coating to let light in
item.description: Cornea = Transparent area of outer coating to let light in

item.title: Iris = Coloured part of the eye
item.description: Iris = Coloured part of the eye

item.title: Pupil = gap in eye to let light in
item.description: Pupil = gap in eye to let light in

item.title: Lens = Focuses the light onto the retina
item.description: Lens = Focuses the light onto the retina

item.title: Sclera = tough white outer coating
item.description: Sclera = tough white outer coating

item.title: Choroid = black layer which reduces internal reflection in the eye
item.description: Choroid = black layer which reduces internal reflection in the eye

item.title: Retina = Light sensitive layer
item.description: Retina = Light sensitive layer

item.title: Optic Nerve = takes signal from eye to brain
item.description: Optic Nerve = takes signal from eye to brain

item.title: Blind spot = Where the optic nerve is attached to the eye
item.description: Blind spot = Where the optic nerve is attached to the eye

item.title: Reaction - Stimulus>Receptor>Coordinator>Effector
item.description: Reaction - Stimulus>Receptor>Coordinator>Effector

item.title: Plant Responses - slow, often involve growth towards or away from a source
item.description: Plant Responses - slow, often involve growth towards or away from a source

item.title: Plant Responses know as tropisms
item.description: Plant Responses know as tropisms

item.title: Phototropism and Gravitropism are light and gravity
item.description: Phototropism and Gravitropism are light and gravity

item.title: Homeostatis - keeping conditions in the body constant
item.description: Homeostatis - keeping conditions in the body constant

item.title: Need homeostatis for metabolism - optimum conditions
item.description: Need homeostatis for metabolism - optimum conditions

item.title: Homeostatis relies on hormones
item.description: Homeostatis relies on hormones

item.title: Hormones - Chemical messengers, travel in the bloodstream
item.description: Hormones - Chemical messengers, travel in the bloodstream

item.title: Glucose is the main source of energy
item.description: Glucose is the main source of energy

item.title: If glucose levels too high, insulin released
item.description: If glucose levels too high, insulin released

item.title: If gluscose levels are too low, glucagon released
item.description: If gluscose levels are too low, glucagon released

item.title: Insulin converts glucose to glycogen (to the liver)
item.description: Insulin converts glucose to glycogen (to the liver)

item.title: Glucagon converts glycoen back to glucose
item.description: Glucagon converts glycoen back to glucose

item.title: If body produces litte or no insulin - Diabetes
item.description: If body produces litte or no insulin - Diabetes

item.title: Negative Feedback is the releasing of hormones - See Book
item.description: Negative Feedback is the releasing of hormones - See Book

item.title: Type 1 Diabetes - Body stops producing insulin (common in young)
item.description: Type 1 Diabetes - Body stops producing insulin (common in young)

item.title: Type 2 Diabetes - body cells dont respond properly to insulin produced
item.description: Type 2 Diabetes - body cells dont respond properly to insulin produced

item.title: Treatment of Type 1 - Injection with insulin, diet management, pancreatic tissue transplant
item.description: Treatment of Type 1 - Injection with insulin, diet management, pancreatic tissue transplant

item.title: Treatment of Type 2 - Controlled with medication/diet
item.description: Treatment of Type 2 - Controlled with medication/diet

item.title: Temperature regulation - Thermoregulation - keeps enzymes' optimum
item.description: Temperature regulation - Thermoregulation - keeps enzymes' optimum

item.title: Too hot - Vasolidation, Sweating and Hair
item.description: Too hot - Vasolidation, Sweating and Hair

item.title: Too Cold, Vasoconstriction, shivering and Hair
item.description: Too Cold, Vasoconstriction, shivering and Hair

item.title: Negative feedback maintains optimum conditions inside the body
item.description: Negative feedback maintains optimum conditions inside the body

item.title: The purpose of the kidney is to regulate the water content of the blood
item.description: The purpose of the kidney is to regulate the water content of the blood

item.title: Not enough water - Dehydration and can be fatal
item.description: Not enough water - Dehydration and can be fatal

item.title: Chemical reactions in the body take place in an aqueous solution
item.description: Chemical reactions in the body take place in an aqueous solution

item.title: Kidney also removes waste products from the blood
item.description: Kidney also removes waste products from the blood

item.title: Urea is made in the liver as a byproduct of the breakdown of proteins
item.description: Urea is made in the liver as a byproduct of the breakdown of proteins

item.title: Urea is a poisonous substance that cannot be allowed to build up
item.description: Urea is a poisonous substance that cannot be allowed to build up

item.title: Urea is removed by the kidney
item.description: Urea is removed by the kidney

item.title: Out to In - Cortex,(nephron), Medulla, Pelvis, ureter
item.description: Out to In - Cortex,(nephron), Medulla, Pelvis, ureter

item.title: Blood is brought to the kidney in the renal artery
item.description: Blood is brought to the kidney in the renal artery

item.title: The kidney regulates the water and salt and removes the urea
item.description: The kidney regulates the water and salt and removes the urea

item.title: The filtered excess products form a liquid called urine
item.description: The filtered excess products form a liquid called urine

item.title: Urine travels down the ureters into the bladder
item.description: Urine travels down the ureters into the bladder

item.title: Purified blood returns through the renal vein
item.description: Purified blood returns through the renal vein

item.title: See Book For Nephron
item.description: See Book For Nephron

item.title: Anti Diuretic Hormone - ADH regulates water reabsorbed by kidney
item.description: Anti Diuretic Hormone - ADH regulates water reabsorbed by kidney

item.title: ADH released by the pituitry gland
item.description: ADH released by the pituitry gland

item.title: More ADH means more water reabsorbed in the nephrons
item.description: More ADH means more water reabsorbed in the nephrons

item.title: Kidney dialysis is running blood through a machine to be filtered
item.description: Kidney dialysis is running blood through a machine to be filtered

item.title: Kidney Transplant is transfer of a healthy kidney into your body
item.description: Kidney Transplant is transfer of a healthy kidney into your body

item.title: Adv - KT - Live nearly normally, dont need dialysis, doesnt disrupt life
item.description: Adv - KT - Live nearly normally, dont need dialysis, doesnt disrupt life

item.title: Adv - KD - Work straight away, no need for drugs
item.description: Adv - KD - Work straight away, no need for drugs

item.title: D.Adv - KT - risk of rejection, risk ok infection because of drugs, limited timeframe
item.description: D.Adv - KT - risk of rejection, risk ok infection because of drugs, limited timeframe

item.title: D.Adv - KD - time consuming, cost lots, 3 days a week, restricted diet, low blood pressure
item.description: D.Adv - KD - time consuming, cost lots, 3 days a week, restricted diet, low blood pressure
